Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2010 01:45PM MIchelle67 wrote: Thank you ladies!!!!  I thought as much and tried to be busy after yesterday morning. You were all right, that helped a lot. I went for the dx bloodwork - three big vials drawn - and then treated myself (after the 12-gr bloodwork fast) to a bagel and good coffee! :) Them I went & had my hair done. I know it sounds stupid, but I actually waited until I found out that I probably won't need chemo (my BS said that, but I know it could change) to make an appt. My hairdresser was the first person I've seen face-to-face since my dx, other than my DH and two daughters. And I think this was meant to be - she has multiple sclerosis and a host of other chronic health issues, & although she's not had bc, it was so great to spend a couple of hours with her. Due to her health, she works out of her home, so it was just the two of us while we updated my punk-rock 'do (I go platinum with black streaks - always been a renegade!)  and we talked the whole time about how one phone call can change your life - and how that news doesn't have to be asbad as it first seems. She hugged me when I left and told me to call her anytimefor support - it wasalmost like hangng out with one of you guys & I felt better, tho' we both got teary. The last night my DH and I took our girls to a scheduled gingerbread house decorating party at my 6 yr.old's school. I thought I'd lose it and have to go hide, but it actually made me feel better, and I *didn't* think about it for an hour! We came home and watched old movies til 10pm and I actually slept for 8+ hours.  I think I will take the advice for the pharaceiutical assistance, though, just in case. I know the road ahead isn't going to stay so smooth. I cannot say how much I am grateful for you girls - I need to know there is that understanding out there, and positive stories. I send you all big hugs, happy tears and wishes for a fabulous weekend! :) Michelle
